headline: Goldman Funds Take $900 Million Hit on Northvolt Stake, FT Says
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Funds managed by Goldman Sachs Asset Management are set to write off almost $900 million on investments in Swedish battery maker Northvolt AB, which filed for bankruptcy protection this week, the Financial Times reported, citing letters to investors it has seen.Most Read from BloombergNYC's Underground Steam System May Be Key to a Greener FutureNYC Gets Historic Push for 80,000 Homes With $5 Billion PledgeTrump Promises Could Have Seismic Impact on Washington EconomyNYC Mayor Adam

headline: Goldman funds to take $900 million hit on Northvolt, FT reports
summary: The Goldman private equity funds, which together ranked as the second-largest shareholders in Northvolt, plan to write down their $896 million investment to zero by year end, the report said, citing letters to investors seen by the FT.  Northvolt did not immediately respond to a Reuters request for comment.

headline: 7 Stocks I'm Buying In Defiance Of Post-Election Euphoria
summary: There is a dangerous euphoria in certain stock sectors. Here's my dividend stock buy list, which have not enjoyed even a little bit of the post-election optimism.
